creator: alastair-a
title: Task Manager - a Household Chore Management System
description: The Task Manager is an Arduino-based system designed to allocate, motivate, and reward individuals for completing household chores. It allows for easy management of tasks, recording of task completion, and tracking of task schedules.
steps: Connect the 16x2 LCD display and DS1307 RTC to the Arduino using the I2C interface (A4 and A5 pins).
Connect the MFRC-522 RFID reader to the Arduino using the SPI interface (pins 11, 12, 13) and define slave select and reset pins (10 and 9 respectively).
Connect the rotary encoder to the Arduino, ideally using pins that support external interrupts (pins 2 and 3). The encoder's switch can be wired to pin 4.
Optionally, create a 3D printed case or use an alternative enclosure to house the electronics.
Upload the provided Arduino code to the board.
Run the sketch with the Arduino serial monitor attached to determine the RFID tag IDs of each user.
Modify the user list in the code to assign the correct RFID tag IDs to each user.
Users can use the rotary encoder to scroll through the list of available tasks displayed on the LCD.
Overdue tasks are marked with an asterisk.
Users can scan their RFID tag after selecting a chore to mark it as complete. The system records the user ID and timestamp.
For RTC modules with recharchable LiPo batteries, modifications may be needed to disable the charging circuit if a non-rechargeable battery is used.
